SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Interface CustomReader

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface CustomReader

A CustomReader gives you full control over how a value is extracted from a ResultSet. It simply hands you the ResultSet and lets you extract the value yourself. If the value is to be assigned to a JavaBean property or record component, it is your responsibility to ensure the value is type-compatible with the property or component, or a ClassCastException will follow.

Of course, you can, in fact, do anything you like with the ResultSet acquired through a CustomReader, including closing it. Klojang JDBC does not protect itself against such unintended usage and you will most likely trigger an exception if you keep making Klojang JDBC calls afterward.

See Also:
  • SessionConfig.getCustomReader(Class, String, Class, int)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Object
    getValue(ResultSet resultSet, int columnIndex)
    Retrieves the value of the designated column in the current row of the specified ResultSet.

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      Object getValue(ResultSet resultSet, int columnIndex) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the value of the designated column in the current row of the specified ResultSet.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - the ResultSet
      columnIndex - the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
      Returns:
      the column value
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the columnIndex is not valid or if a database access error occurs
